climbs.name: Good Friday
climbs.fa: Bob Gaines and Keith Brueckner, March 1997.

content.description: Climb the face between Sunset Strip and Rodeo Drive. The difficulty depends on how much you use the holds adjacent to the crack on the right (Rodeo Drive).
content.protection:
TR

Two #4 camalots are useful to rig a toprope anchor, as is a short extension rope.

climbs.name: Walk of Fame
climbs.fa: Sean Tang, Kelly Corbin,  Rebecca Dulatre Corbin, 12/2019.

content.description:
Start up a shallow pod that has a left-slanting thin crack that splits it and continues up out of its top.  The thin splitter leads to juggy features, passes two prominent upper horizontals on its left, and finishes into a narrow gap on the left side of the tall pointy pinnacle.  Hollywood Boulevard finishes on the other side of this pinnacle, topping out on its right.

Loose flakes and plates suggested likely no previous traffic up this.  If otherwise, happy to update with original FA info.
content.protection: Single rack to 3" with extra BD 0.5 to 1, gear anchor.

climbs.name: Sunset Strip
climbs.fa: Alan Bartlett and Debbie Daigle, March 1988

content.description: Climb a flake to a left-slanting crack.  The crux is face climbing past a thin section of the crack.  This route is not sustained.
content.location: On the west face of the rock.

climbs.name: Rodeo Drive
climbs.fa: Todd Swain and Mark Bowling, November 1989.

content.description: Climb the crack/corner about 15 feet right of Sunset Strip, moving left onto the face at the top.
content.location: On the west face of the rock.

content.description: Climb thin cracks up to a right-facing dihedral.
content.location: On the left side of the west face.
